section.para: This function allows users to directly create multiple fund transfers as part of a single bulk transaction by entering details on the user interface or by uploading a suitably formatted file. Bulk fund transfer types, referred to as Product Group in , are further classified into three different forms: Collection, Payment and Payroll. The following list provides an overview for each type:

listitem.para: Collection – refers to a bulk transaction where you request banks to transfer funds from third-party accounts and credit your beneficiary account, for example, funds transfer through a direct debit process. Where appropriate mandates are in place, this allows you to collect payments from a third party, for example, to settle bills.

Payment – refers to a bulk transaction where you specify multiple credits to third-party accounts, debiting a single account within your organisation. This can be made through any supported payment mechanism, for example, RTGS.

Payroll – refers to a bulk transaction that is similar to the standard Payment, except that it requires additional permissions. When selecting Payroll, the user is also required to select the Payroll Type from: Employee or Executive, to classify the contents of the bulk transaction. Note that the only difference between Employee and Executive Payroll Types are the permissions and required approvals, which allows the user to further segregate the audience that is able to view and action payroll payments for executive staff.

section.para:
When a Bulk transaction is created, the transaction is initially defined, then the individual fund transfer requests are added. When submitted, the bank will review all the transfer requests and approve (or reject) them as a single entity. The Move button in a bulk transaction form, allows fund transfers to be moved from one bulk request to another, provided the bulk has been submitted and not yet approved. Cash Services
Bulk Services
Bulk Services

section.title: Bulk Services Terminology
section.para: The Bulk Services function allows "Bulk Transactions" to be created, containing "Fund Transfer requests". Bulk Transactions are also referred to as "Bulk Orders".

section.title: Bulk Services - Navigation
section.para: To navigate to the Bulk Services function, from the tool bar, select Cash Services > Bulk Services.

section.title: Bulk Services - Functions
section.para: After selecting Cash Services > Bulk Services from the toolbar, a number of functions are provided for Bulk Services in the left side navigation menu.
The following Functions are available in the Bulk Services navigation menu:

listitem.para: Create and maintain new Bulk Orders
List and maintain Bulks that have not been authorised.
Maintain bulks that have not been approved by the bank.

section.title: Bulk Services - Initiation Options
section.para: Creating and maintaining new Bulk Services is performed through the Bulk Services Initiation Function. After selecting Cash Services > Bulk Services from the toolbar, the Initiation function can be selected from the left side navigation menu, to display the available Initiation options.
The following options are available for Bulk Services Initiation.

listitem.para: Create a new Bulk Order (or template) New.
Create a new Bulk Order from an existing template.
Create a new Bulk Order from an existing record.
Create a new Bulk Order from an uploaded file.
Review, complete and submit Bulk Services records that a user has already created and saved, but not submitted.
Review and submit Bulk Services records that a user has, but have not been submitted due to lack of authority.
Check the results from Bulk Orders created from file uploads.

section.title: Initiation - From Scratch
section.para: When creating a new Bulk Service transaction using the New option from the left navigation menu, a set of initial details must be supplied through the first screen displayed.

note.para: This section raises a Bulk Services request that must be approved (and actioned) by the bank.

section.para: The details required are:

Field
Type
Description
Entity
Enter the Entity the payment is to come from. Click the magnifying glass icon to display and select from a list of valid Entities.
Bank
The bank holding the requested account.
If you are linked to more than one bank, the Bank dropdown is available. If you are linked to only one bank, this field doesn’t appear.
Product Group
Select the correct product group from the dropdown menu. Valid product groups are:Collection Payment Payroll
Payroll Type
Select the correct Payroll type from the dropdown menu. This field will only be displayed if the Product Group is Payroll. Valid Payroll types are:Employee Executive
Product Type
Select the correct product type from the dropdown menu. Valid payment types will vary, depending on the payment group.Domestic Fund Transfer Third Party Fund Transfer Internal Fund Transfer India Domestic Transfer
Bulk Type
The type of bulk fund transfer information. This is a read-only field.
Transfer To
Enter the account collections are to be transferred to. Click the magnifying glass icon to display and select from a list of valid accounts. This field will only be displayed if the Product Group is Collection.
Transfer From
Enter the account payments are to be transferred from. Click the magnifying glass icon to display and select from a list of valid accounts. This field will only be displayed if the Product Group is Payment.
Currency
Enter the currency to be used by the Bulk Order. Click the magnifying glass icon to display and select from a list of valid currency codes.
When all fields have been completed, click the Ok button to specify the other Bulk details. The fields on this form will vary, depending on the product group and type requested. The following sections describe the details required.

section.title: New form - General Details
section.para: The general details section describe the details already entered.

entry.para: Field
Type
Description

row.entry: The Entity the bulk Order is for.

entry.para: The account the bulk is to be transferred from. This field will not be displayed if the Product Group is Collection.
The account the bulk is to be transferred to. This field will only be displayed if the Product Group is Collection.
The Product Type requested on the initial screen.
The Product Group requested on the initial screen.
The Payroll Type requested on the initial screen.

note.para: This field is displayed if you select Payroll from the Product Group.

entry.para: Enter the description of the Bulk Order.
Displays that the beneficiary is a pre-approved beneficiary.
Unique reference number generated by for this Bulk Order.
Enter a template ID if a template is to be created. After entering all required details, Click the Save Template button to save the template for later use.
Today's Date
Select the date of the bulk transfer.

row.entry: Enter the Customer reference number for the bulk upload. If not entered, it will default to the Bulk System ID.

section.title: New form - Bulk Summary
section.para:
This section displays a summary of the existing Fund Transfer requests associated with this Bulk Order.
Field
Type
Description
Total Amount of Records
The amount total of fund transfer records included in this bulk,
No of Records
The total number of fund transfer records included in this bulk,
Highest Amount of Records
The highest amount that can be included in a single record.

Click the Add transaction button to add a new fund transfer request. When completed, the new request will appear in a list under the Search Options heading. Entries in this table can be edited or deleted before the Bulk order is generated.

section.title: New form - Bulk Summary: Search Options
section.para: This section allows the list of fund transfers to be filtered to only display the required types.

Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. These are the Bulk Ref, Bank Code, Branch No, Account Number and Account Name Fields. The list will display any Fund transfer requests that have been created or added to this Bulk transaction. The fields displayed are:
Field
Description
Bulk Ref
Unique reference number generated by for this Bulk, when it was initiated.
Bank Code
The Code identifying the beneficiaries bank.
Branch Number
The code identifying the Branch number of the beneficiaries account.
Account Number
The account the payment is to be made to.
Account Name
The name of the beneficiary's account.
Amount
The amount to be transferred in this request.
Status
The status of the request. (valid, Etc.)
Each record is shown with one or more of the following action icons to the right of the entry, depending on its status:

entry.para: Symbol
Description
Click to open the fund transfer request in edit mode, to change its details
Click to delete the fund transfer request.

section.para: Click the Add transaction button to add a new fund transfer request.

section.title: New form - Add Transaction
section.para: When the Add Transaction button is clicked, the following fields appear.

note.para: These fields may change depending on the Product Type defined for the Bulk Transaction.

entry.para: Field
Type
Description

row.entry: A unique reference id provided by the system to identify the Bulk record.

entry.para: The ID of the company creating the Bulk.
The account the bulk is to be transferred from.
The Product Type requested on the initial screen.
The name of the bank providing the bulk.
Unique reference number generated by for this Bulk Order.
Today's Date

row.entry: This heading is only displayed when a new transaction is added

entry.para: The name of the company to transfer the bulk to. All fields are "auto Filled" when the Name field is completed.
The number of the account
This is only displayed if the selected account is a pre-approved beneficiary.
Select the Purpose of the transfer.
The Bank and Branch codes
The name of the bank
The name of the bank Branch.

row.entry: This heading is only displayed when a new transaction is added

entry.para: The amount of the transaction
The customer reference number for the bulk transaction
Enter the specific particulars to the transfer
Enter the date the transfer is due to take place.
Enter the beneficiaries reference number.
Enter the system code for the transaction, from the dropdown menu.

row.entry: This heading is only displayed when an Internal Funds Transfer Payment is selected.
Select the Foreign Exchange Rates from Use Prevailing Board Rates and Use FX Contract(s)
Select this option to use prevailing board rates.
Select this option to use FX contracts.

entry.para: Enter the exchange rate. This field is available only for the Use Prevailing Board Rates option.
Enter the tolerance rate. This field is available only for the Use Prevailing Board Rates option.
Displays the equivalent rate in the foreign currency based on the exchange rate. This field is available only for the Use Prevailing Board Rates option.
Displays the equivalent rate in the foreign currency based on the tolerance. This field is available only for the Use Prevailing Board Rates option.
Enter the FX contract number. This field is available only for the Use FX Contract(s) option.
Enter the amount to use for the FX contract. This field is available only for the Use FX Contract(s) option.
Displays the total amount for the FX contracts. This field is available only for the Use FX Contract(s) option.
Add beneficiary email notifications details here.

row.entry: Select to send a notification to the beneficiary's email ID.
Select to send an email notification to the beneficiary's default email ID entered in Finastra Portal.
Select to send an email notification to the beneficiary's alternative email ID and enter it in the text box.

entry.para: Transaction Remarks (Reference is used within Business Internet Banking only)
Enter any extra relevant remarks for this transaction. Click the button to the right of this field, to select predefined phrases to insert into this field.

section.para: Click the Add button to add the new Fund transfer request. When completed, the new request will appear in a list under the Search Options heading in the Bulk Summary section. Entries in this table can be edited or deleted before the Bulk order is generated.

entry.para: Name
Type
Description

row.entry: Click this button to save the current Bulk Transaction. The Bulk Transaction will be saved with a status of "Draft" and can be updated and finalised at a later time.

This option will submit the Bulk Transaction for submission to the bank. If further Authorisations are required, it will be held back with a status of "Unsigned" until submitted by an Authorizing user.

entry.para: Click this button to create a template form with the current details pre-saved. The template name should be entered in the general Details section. This can then be used at a later stage to create further Bulk Transactions with similar details.
Click this button cancel the creation of the current Bulk Transaction and to clear any details.
This button displays an online help facility that describes the fields associated with the Bulk Transaction.

note.para: Saving the transaction will allow it to be edited at a later stage and more Fund Transfer requests added. Funds will not be transferred until the Bulk Transaction has been submitted to, and approved by, the bank.

section.title: New form - Move Transactions Details
section.para: When Move button is selected, a window is displayed showing all the transactions of the current bulk. This function can also be performed when editing a previously saved Bulk transaction.

The upper part provides filtering function to help the user to locate specific submitted but unapproved Bulk transactions. Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. These are the Bulk Ref, Bank Code, Branch No, Account Number and Account Name Fields.

To move the Fund transfer request, select the desired Bulk transaction from the list by clicking the check box to the left of the entry, then click on the Move to New Bulk button. To cancel the move, simply navigate away from the page.

section.title: Initiation - From Template
section.para: When creating a new Bulk transaction, a previously saved template can be used to pre-populate common fields of the Bulk transaction form. Templates need to have been created at an earlier stage for them to be used (see Bulk Services - New for more information on creating templates.)

The "From Template" option allows a previously created template to be used as a basis for a new Bulk Order. To use a template, select this option from the left side navigation menu of the Cash services > Bulk Services page, and a list of existing templates will be displayed.

Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. These are Reference, Entity or Description field. To display all templates, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields.

The columns returned in the list of templates are described as follows:
Field
Description
Reference
Template name
Entity
Entity the template is associated with.
Description
A description of the template
Product Type
The type of fund transfer record.
Records
The number of transactions included in the template
Ccy
The currency of the bulk order Template.
Amount
The amount of the bulk order Template.
Each record is shown with one or more of the following action icons to the right of the entry, depending on its status:

entry.para: Symbol
Description
Click to edit the current master details of the record.
Click to delete the transaction.

section.para: Select a template by clicking on the Reference field of the required entry. This option will user the same form as the New option, but some fields will be pre-populated from the template. Complete or change the required fields in the rest of the form and click the Submit button at the top (or bottom) of the screen when ready.

section.title: Initiation - Copy From
section.para: Select this option from the side navigation menu, to create a new Bulk transaction, using an existing one as a model. When this option is selected from the side navigation menu of the Cash services > Bulk Services page, a list of existing Bulk transaction will be displayed.

Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. These are System ID, Entity, Bank Ref, Beneficiary Name or Ccy field. To display all orders and drafts, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields. The list is not displayed until search criteria has been entered and the Search button has been clicked.

The columns returned in the list of transactions are described as follows:
Field
Description
System ID
Unique reference number generated by for this file, when the Bulk transaction was initiated.
Entity
Entity the payment is associated with.
Bank Ref
The type of record. (New, etc.)
Our Ref
The unique number used by clients for this Bulk transaction.
Beneficiary Name
The beneficiary of this Bulk transaction.
Ccy
The currency of the payment.
Amount
The amount of the payment.

Select an entry to copy, by clicking on the System ID field of the required entry. The standard order/draft form will be displayed, with most fields populated with values from the original request. Complete or change the required fields in the form and click the Submit button at the top (or bottom) of the screen when ready.

section.title: Initiation - From Upload
section.para: Bulk services can be created from an uploaded file if required. When creating a new Bulk transaction from an uploaded file, the following details are requested. As this function allows for different types of bulks to be generated, some of the fields may change depending on the type of bulks generated.
When From Upload is selected from the left navigation list of the Cash services > Bulk Services page, the Bulk Upload Order Initiation form is displayed.

section.title: From Upload form - General Details
section.para: The general details section describe the details already entered.

entry.para: Field
Type
Description

row.entry: Enter the Entity the bulk upload is for. Click the magnifying glass icon to display and select from a list of valid Entities.

entry.para: Select the Bank associated to the bulk file upload from the list in the dropdown menu. Only Banks linked to the selected Entity are displayed in the list.

row.entry: Enter the description of the Bulk upload
Enter the Customer reference number for the bulk upload. Will be defaulted as bulk reference for the generated bulks

entry.para: Select the file type form the dropdown menu.
Enter the account funds are to be transferred from, if applicable. Click the magnifying glass icon to display and select from a list of valid accounts.
Enter the value date of the Bulks, if applicable.

section.title: From Upload form - File Upload Details

entry.para: Field
Type
Description

row.entry: A table will be displayed listed all files selected to be uploaded, if any exist.
An icon representing the type of file to be uploaded.
This column shows the title of all documents that have been uploaded if files have been added.
This column shows the file name of all documents that have been uploaded if files have been added.

entry.para: Click this button to download the file to the local system.
Click this button to delete the uploaded file.
Click this button to upload a new file from a local hard disk. The system will request the title and location of the document to upload.
Name
Type
Description

row.entry: This option will upload and automatically create the bulk transaction.

entry.para: Click this button cancel the creation of the current New Bulk request and to clear any details.
This button displays an online help facility that describes the fields associated with the New Bulk request.

note.para: The Bank must still approve this request.

section.title: Initiation - Edit Transactions
section.para: When this option is selected from the side navigation menu of the Cash services > Bulk Services page, it allows a new Bulk Order request that a user has already started and saved, to be completed. Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter.

When selected, this option will present a list of Bulk Order requests that have been prepared and saved by users in the bank, but not yet submitted to the clients because the input user either did not try to submit or had insufficient privileges. Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter.
Click on the System ID column of the required entry to open it for further editing.

section.title: Initiation - Retrieve Unsigned
section.para: When this option is selected from the side navigation menu of the Cash services > Bulk Services page, it allows a new Bulk Order requests that a user has already started but been unable to submit, to be submitted by an authorised user. Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter.

When selected, this option will present a list of new Bulk Order requests that have been prepared and saved by users in the bank, but have not been successfully submitted to the clients because the user had insufficient privileges. Records that were simply saved with no attempt to submit them are not included. Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter.

Click on the System ID column of the required entry to open it in a non-editable mode, in order to review the data and perform the submission. When clicked, the Users icon will display the user that created the transaction, and any users that have edited, authorised or verified it.

If there is sufficient authorisation in the users profile, multiple records can be submitted in a single operation directly from the list. Each record in the list has a check box which when selected is ticked. A button at the end of the page submits all the selected records.

The result of the action is then returned, with a list of records that have now been successfully sent to the clients, together with a list of records that have again failed validation. The updated list of unsigned records is then also displayed.

section.title: Initiation - Uploaded File Results
section.para: When Bulk Orders are generated from a file upload, selecting the Uploaded File results option from the left navigation list of the Cash services > Bulk Services page, will allow the user to view the results of the uploaded bulks. Initially a list of bulk transactions will be displayed.

Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. These are System ID, Entity, File Type, Product group, Product Type, File Name or Upload Date From and To fields.

The columns returned in the list of Bulk Transactions are the following:
Field
Description
File System ID
Unique reference number generated by for this file, when it was initiated.
Entity
The Entity associated with the transaction.
File Type
The type of file that was uploaded
Product Group
The product group assigned to the transaction.
Product type
The product type assigned to the transaction.
File Name
The name assigned to the file when it was uploaded.
Upload Date
The date the file was uploaded.
User Name
The name of the User who created/uploaded the bulk.
Status
The status of the transaction
Actions
A list of actions that can be performed against this transaction.

section.title: Pending Bulks
section.para: This function will display a list of all Bulks records that have not been approved by the bank. To use this function, after selecting Cash services > Bulk Services from the toolbar, click on Pending Bulks on the left side navigation menu. These bulk transactions can be edited or submitted as required by any user with the appropriate authorities.

Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. These are Entity, System ID, Status, Bulk Customer Reference, Ccy, Amount or Last Modified Dates fields. To display all records, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields.
The columns returned in the list of system are the following:

entry.para: Field
Description
Unique reference number generated by for this file, when it was initiated.
The Entity associated with the bulk order.
The type of record. (New, etc.)
The Status of the Pending Bulk Transaction
The number of records in the bulk order.
The Currency of the bulk order.
The amount of the bulk order.
The user that created the bulk order.

section.para: Each record is shown with one or more of the following action icons to the left of the entry, depending on its status:

entry.para: Symbol
Description
Click to open a popup window displaying the current master details of the record.
Click to view the Bulk record in Control Mode (view only).
Click to edit the current master details of the record.

section.title: Bulks Inquiry
section.para: The Bulk Inquiry function can be used by selecting Cash services > Bulk Services from the toolbar, then clicking on Bulks Inquiry on the left side navigation menu. This function will display a list of all Bulk records that have been approved by the bank. These can be view or printed as required.

Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. These are Entity, System ID, Bank Ref, Status, Bulk Customer Reference, Ccy, Amount or Last Modified Dates fields. The list is not displayed until search criteria has been entered and the Search button has been clicked. To display all records, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields.

The columns returned in the list of Bulk records are the following:
Field
Description
System ID
Unique reference number generated by for this file, when it was initiated.
Entity
The Entity associated with the bulk order.
Bank Ref.
The reference ID assigned and used by the bank for this record.
Our Ref.
The customer Reference ID.
Records
The number of records in the bulk order.
Ccy
The Currency of the bulk order.
Amount
The amount of the bulk order.
Value date
The date the bulk value is to be realised.
Status
The status of the bulk order.
Each record is shown with one or more of the following action icons to the left of the entry, depending on its status:

entry.para: Symbol
Description
Click to open a popup window displaying the current master details of the record.

Click to display a history list of all events for the record, detailing the complete history of the file. For each event in the life of the file, the list shows the Release Date, the Type of the event, the Status, the Currency and transaction Amount (e.g. the Purchase Order amount), and the Entities of the input and supervising users.
Click to edit the current master details of the record.
Click to delete the transaction.

section.title: Bulks Maintenance
section.para: This function is user to maintain Bulks records that were created, but are no longer required in the system.

section.title: Bulks Maintenance - Options
section.para: After selecting Cash Services > Bulk Services from the toolbar, the Bulks Services function allows access to the Bulks Maintenance options through links in the left side navigation menu.
The following options are available for Bulks Maintenance:

listitem.para: List and optionally delete unsigned (unauthorised) Bulks transactions.
List and optionally delete Bulks transactions that have been marked as Purged by the Issuing Bank's Trade Services team.
List and optionally delete Rejected transactions.

section.title: Bulks Maintenance - Unsigned Bulks
section.para: Select the Unsigned Bulks option from the left side navigation menu of the Cash services > Bulks Maintenance page, to list and optionally delete unsigned (unauthorised) Bulks transactions. When this option is selected from the side navigation menu, it presents a list of records that are unsigned (unauthorised).

Click the Search Options link to display a list of search criteria, the list can be filtered by. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter. Further amendments or messages cannot be initiated on such a transaction, and can only use its data for inquiry purposes.
The user can delete one or more records in a single operation placing a tick in the check box on the left of the entry, and clicking the Delete selected transactions button at the bottom of the page.

section.title: Bulks Maintenance - Purged Bulks
section.para: Select the Purged Bulks option from the left side navigation menu of the Cash services > Bulks Maintenance page, to list and optionally delete Bulks transactions that have been marked as Purged by the Issuing Bank's Trade Services team. Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter.
Further amendments or messages cannot be initiated on such a transaction, and can only use its data for inquiry purposes.
The user can delete one or more records in a single operation placing a tick in the check box on the left of the entry, and clicking the Delete selected transactions button at the bottom of the page.

section.title: Bulks Maintenance - Rejected Bulks
section.para: Select the Rejected Bulks option from the left side navigation menu of the Cash services > Bulks Maintenance page, to list and optionally delete Rejected transactions. Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter.

When this option is selected from the side navigation menu, it presents a list of Bulks records that were submitted, but rejected by the bank and have a status of "Not Processed". Further amendments or messages cannot be initiated on such a transaction, and can only use its data for inquiry purposes.
The user can delete one or more records in a single operation placing a tick in the check box on the left of the entry, and clicking the Delete selected transactions button at the bottom of the page.

section.title: Bulk Files Maintenance
section.para: The Files Maintenance function can be used by selecting Cash services > Bulk Files Maintenance from the toolbar on the left side navigation menu. This function will display a list of all files uploaded for bulks. These can be viewed or printed as required.

Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. These are System ID, Entity, File Type, Product group, Product Type, File Name or Upload Date From/To fields. To display all records, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields.

The columns returned in the list of Bulk records are the following:
Field
Description
File System ID
Unique reference number generated by for this file, when it was initiated.
Entity
The Entity associated with the bulk order.
File Type
The type of file that was uploaded.
Product Group
The product group included in the file.
Product Type
The Product type included in the File
File Name
The name of the file.
Upload Date
the date the file was uploaded.
User Name
The name of the user that uploaded the file.
Status
The status of the Upload.

Transactions can be viewed by clicking on the View
icon to the left of each entry.

section.title: Bulk File Upload Format - Flexi
section.para: This section describes about the allowed formats for Bulk File Upload. The Flexi file format is a comma separated format, where each line (record) contains all the details pertaining to a single transaction. Individual fields in a transaction record are separated by a comma (,). As each field is identified by its position in the record as the string to the next separator, columns with no value must be specified as a single separator, that is comma (,). Hence the separator character (,) must not be used within any field value, even when the Field Type allows SWIFT X characters. Sample File

section.title: Internal Transfer
section.para:
The following table shows the list of parameters present in the Internal Transfer Flexi bulk file upload:
Field Name
Field Length
Field Type
Selection Type
Description
Debit Account
34
Alphanumeric
Mandatory
The account number to be debited for the fund transfer
Transfer Currency
3
Alpha
Mandatory
Transaction currency code. It should be the same as debit account currency
Transfer Date
10
Date
Mandatory
This is the execution date of the transfer as requested by the customer. For format of the date refer section "Date and Amounts Format".
Transfer to Account Number
34
Alphanumeric
Mandatory
The account number to which the funds are to be transferred.
Transfer Amount
15
Amount
Mandatory
Numeric value of transfer amount, with a single decimal separator - no comma separator for amounts. Examples - For a two decimal currency, the maximum would be 999999999999.99 for a three decimal currency, the maximum would be 99999999999.999 and for a currency with no decimals it would be 999999999999.
Bulk Customer Reference
16
Alphanumeric and Special characters
Optional
Customer attributed reference for the bulk. If left blank defaults to the system generated bulk reference.
Customer Reference
16
Alphanumeric and Special characters
Optional
Customer attributed reference for the transaction.
Beneficiary Reference
19
Alphanumeric and Special characters
Optional
Beneficiary reference provided by the customer user for the transaction.
Transaction Remarks
228
Alphanumeric and Special characters
Optional
These are transaction remarks used within Internet banking.
For information on "Field Type" refer the section "Date and Amount Formats".

section.title: Third Party Transfer
section.para:
The following table shows the list of parameters present in the Third Party Transfer Flexi bulk file upload:
Field Name
Field Length
Field Type
Selection Type
Description
Debit Account
34
Alphanumeric
Mandatory
The account number to be debited for the fund transfer
Transfer Currency
3
Alpha
Mandatory
Transaction currency code. It should be the same as debit account currency
Transfer Date
10
Date
Mandatory
This is the execution date of the transfer as requested by the customer. For format of the date refer section "Date and Amounts Format".
Beneficiary Name
35
Alphanumeric and Spaces
Conditional Mandatory
Name of the beneficiary.The name should begin with an alphabet. This is to be provided only in case of Open beneficiary.
Transfer to Account Number
34
Alphanumeric
Mandatory
The account number to which the funds are to be transferred.
Beneficiary Account Currency
3
Alpha
Conditional Mandatory
Provide this value only in case of Open beneficiary.
Transfer Amount
15
Amount
Mandatory
Numeric value of transfer amount, with a single decimal separator - no comma separator for amounts. Examples - For a two decimal currency, the maximum would be 9999999999999.99 for a three decimal currency, the maximum would be 999999999999.999 and for a currency with no decimals it would be 9999999999999.
Bulk Customer Reference
16
Alphanumeric and Special characters
Optional
Customer attributed reference for the bulk. If left blank defaults to the system generated bulk reference.
Customer Reference
16
Alphanumeric and Special characters
Optional
Customer attributed reference for the transaction.
Beneficiary Reference
19
Alphanumeric and Special characters
Optional
Beneficiary reference provided by the customer user for the transaction.
Transaction Remarks
228
Alphanumeric and Special characters
Optional
These are transaction remarks used within Internet banking.
Notify Beneficiary
1
Alpha
Optional
Indicates whether email is to be sent to the beneficiary. Use Y or N only.
Use default email
1
Alpha
Optional
Indicates whether default email defined for the beneficiary is to be used.Use Y or N only.
Use alternative email
254
Alphanumeric and special characters (valid for an email id)
Conditional Mandatory
Specify in a valid email id format. This is mandatory when the Notify Beneficiary flag is Y and email id has not been defined for the beneficiary.For information on "Field Type" refer the section "Date and Amount Formats".
For an existing beneficiary only Account Number is expected. The beneficiary name and the currency is defaulted from what is defined in the beneficiary master. Even if the beneficiary name and currency are defined in addition to beneficiary account the values are defaulted according to the definition of beneficiary master.
For an open beneficiary the account number, beneficiary name and currency all three are mandatory fields.
For information on "Field Type" refer the section "Date and Amount Formats".

section.title: MT103 Transfer
section.para:
The following table shows the list of parameters present in the MT103 Transfer Flexi bulk file upload:
Field Name
Field Length
Field Type
Selection Type
Description
Debit Account
34
Alphanumeric
Mandatory
The account number to be debited for the fund transfer
Transfer Currency
3
Alpha
Mandatory
Transaction currency code. It should be the same as debit account currency
Transfer Date
10
Date
Mandatory
This is the execution date of the transfer as requested by the customer. For format of the date refer section "Date and Amounts Format".
Beneficiary Account Number
34
Alphanumeric
Mandatory
The account number to which the funds are to be transferred.
Transfer Amount
15
Amount
Mandatory
Numeric value of transfer amount, with a single decimal separator - no comma separator for amounts. Examples - For a two decimal currency, the maximum would be 9999999999999.99 for a three decimal currency, the maximum would be 999999999999.999 and for a currency with no decimals it would be 9999999999999.
Charge Option
3
Alpha
Mandatory
Indicates the party which bears the charges.Must be one of the following values: OUR, SHA or BEN.
Bulk Customer Reference
16
Alphanumeric and Special characters
Optional
Customer attributed reference for the bulk. If left blank defaults to the system generated bulk reference.
Customer Reference
16
Alphanumeric and Special characters
Optional
Customer attributed reference for the transaction.
Remittance Code
35
Alphanumeric and Swift X special characters
Conditional Mandatory
Contains the code for describing the reason for remittance. The bank enables this option as mandatory or optional.
Beneficiary Bank BIC code
11
Alphanumeric
Optional
BIC code of the Beneficiary bank.
Beneficiary Name
35
Alphanumeric and Spaces
Conditional Mandatory
Name of the beneficiary.The name should begin with an alphabet. This is to be provided only in case of Open beneficiary.
Beneficiary Currency
3
Alpha
Conditional Mandatory
Provide this value only in case of Open beneficiary.
Beneficiary Bank Name
35
Alphanumeric and swift X special characters
Conditional Mandatory
This is applicable only in case of Open Beneficiary. Provide this if Beneficiary Bank SWIFT BIC code has not been provided in the upload file.
Beneficiary Bank Address Line 1
35
Alphanumeric and swift X special characters
Conditional Mandatory
This is applicable only in case of Open Beneficiary. Specify this if Beneficiary Bank name has been provided instead of the BANK BIC code in the upload file.
Beneficiary Bank Address Line 2
35
Alphanumeric and swift X special characters
Optional
Similar to Beneficiary Bank Address Line 1.
Beneficiary Bank Address Line 3
35
Alphanumeric and swift X special characters
Optional
Similar to Beneficiary Bank Address Line 1.
Beneficiary Bank Address -Country
2
Alpha
Conditional Mandatory
This is applicable only in case of Open Beneficiary. Specify this if Beneficiary Bank name has been provided instead of the BANK BIC code in the upload file.
Beneficiary Address Line 1
35
Alphanumeric and swift X special characters
Conditional Mandatory
This is to be provided in case of Open beneficiary.
Beneficiary Address Line 2
35
Alphanumeric and swift X special characters
Optional
This may be provided only in case of Open beneficiary.
Beneficiary Address Line 3
35
Alphanumeric and swift X special characters
Optional
This may be provided only in case of Open beneficiary.
Intermediary Bank BIC Code
11
Alphanumeric
Optional
SWIFT BIC code of the Intermediary Bank.
Payment Details to Beneficiary
140
Alphanumeric and swift X special characters
Optional
Payment details narrative to be passed on to Beneficiary through SWIFT message. Max length allowed is 35*4=140.
Instruction to Bank
70
Alphanumeric and swift X special characters
Optional
Payment details narrative to be passed on to Beneficiary Bank through SWIFT message. Max length allowed is 35*2=70.
Notify Beneficiary
1
Alpha
Optional
Indicates whether email is to be sent to the beneficiary. Use Y or N only.
Use default email
1
Alpha
Optional
Indicates whether default email defined for the beneficiary is to be used.Use Y or N only.
Use alternative email
254
Alphanumeric and special characters (valid for an email id)
Conditional Mandatory
Specify in a valid email id format. This is mandatory when the Notify Beneficiary flag is Y and email id has not been defined for the beneficiary.For information on "Field Type" refer the section "Date and Amount Formats".
Beneficiary Bank Branch Address Line 1
35
Alphanumeric and swift X special characters
Optional
This may be provided in case of Open beneficiary.
Beneficiary Bank Branch Address Line 2
35
Alphanumeric and swift X special characters
Optional
This may be provided in case of Open beneficiary.
Beneficiary Bank Branch Address Line 3
35
Alphanumeric and swift X special characters
Optional
This may be provided in case of Open beneficiary.
Intermediary Bank Name
35
Alphanumeric and swift X special characters
Optional
Intermediary Bank Name.
Intermediary Bank Address Line 1
35
Alphanumeric and swift X special characters
Optional
Intermediary Bank Address details.
Intermediary Bank Address Line 2
35
Alphanumeric and swift X special characters
Optional
Intermediary Bank Address details.
Intermediary Bank Address Line 3
35
Alphanumeric and swift X special characters
Optional
Intermediary Bank Address details.
Intermediary Bank Country
2
Alpha
Optional
Country of the Intermediary Bank.
Beneficiary Bank Clearing Code
34
Alphanumeric
Optional
Clearing code for the beneficiary bank. Must be provided in full, like SC401307 for UK Sort Code. The first two characters need to correspond to the national clearing system code.
Intermediary Bank Clearing Code
34
Alphanumeric
Optional
Clearing code for the intermediary bank. Must be provided in full, like SC401307 for UK Sort Code.The first two characters need to correspond to the national clearing system code.
Transaction Remarks
228
Alphanumeric and Special characters
Optional
These are transaction remarks used within Internet banking.
For information on "Field Type" refer the section "Date and Amount Formats".

section.title: India Domestic Transfer
section.para:
The following table shows the list of parameters present in the Internal Transfer Flexi bulk file upload:
Field Name
Field Length
Field Type
Selection Type
Description
Debit Account
34
Alphanumeric
Mandatory
The account number to be debited for the fund transfer
Transfer Currency
3
Alpha
Mandatory
Transaction currency code. Allows only INR.
Transfer Date
10
Date
Mandatory
"This is the execution date of the transfer as requested by the customer. This should be in the format DD/MM/YYYY"
Beneficiary Name
34
Alphanumeric
Conditional Mandatory
Provide this value only in case of Open beneficiary.
Transfer to Account Number
34
Alphanumeric
Mandatory
The account number to which the funds are to be transferred
Beneficiary Account Currency
3
Alpha
Conditional Mandatory
Provide this value only in case of Open beneficiary. Only INR allowed.
IFSC
11
Alphanumeric
Conditional Mandatory
This is the IFS Code of the bank where beneficiary has the account to which funds are to be transferred.Provide this value only in case of Open beneficiary.
Clearing System
4
Alpha
Mandatory
Only either of the values RTGS or NEFT allowed.
Transfer Amount
15
Amount
Mandatory
Numeric amount of transfer, with a single decimal separator - no comma separator for amounts
Bulk Customer Reference
16
Alphanumeric
Optional
Customer attributed reference for the bulk. If left blank defaults to the system generated bulk reference.
Customer Reference
16
Alphanumeric
Optional
Customer attributed reference for the transaction
Beneficiary Reference
19
Alphanumeric
Optional
Beneficiary reference provided by the customer user
Description - Line 1
34
Alphanumeric + SWIFT X special characters
Optional
These are narrative to be passed on to BO.
Description - Line 2
34
Alphanumeric + SWIFT X special characters
Optional
These are narrative to be passed on to BO.
Description - Line 3
34
Alphanumeric + SWIFT X special characters
Optional
These are narrative to be passed on to BO.
Description - Line 4
34
Alphanumeric + SWIFT X special characters
Optional
These are narrative to be passed on to BO.
Notify Beneficiary
1
Y/N
Optional
Indicate whether email is to be sent to the beneficiary.
Use default email
1
Y/N
Optional
Indicate whether default email defined for the beneficiary is to be used
Use alternative email
254
email id
Optional
Specify in a valid email id format. A maximum of 10 emails allowed to be entered, each of the email ids will be separated by “;”.
For information on "Field Type" refer the section "Date and Amount Formats".

section.title: Cancel Post Dated Bulks
section.para: The Cancel Post Dated Bulks function allows post dated bulk fund transfer requested to be cancelled.

section.title: Cancel Post Dated Bulks - Navigation
section.para: To navigate to the Cancel Post Dated Bulks function, from the tool bar, select Cash Services > Bulk Services. Then select Cancel Post Dated Bulks from the left side navigation menu.

section.title: Cancel Post Dated Bulks - Options
section.para: The Cancel Post Dated Bulks function allows access to the Cancel Post Dated Bulks module provided by Cash Portal. In the left side navigation menu of the Cash services > Bulk Services page, a number of options are provided for Cancel Post Dated Bulks.
The following options are available for Cancel Post Dated Transaction.

listitem.para: Terminate an existing Post Dated bulk Transactions.

section.title: Cancel Post Dated Bulks - Cancel Post Dated
section.para: When the Cancel Post Dated Bulks - Cancel Post Dated option is selected from the side navigation menu of the Cash services > Bulk Services page, it will display a list of all current Post Dated Transactions in the system.

Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. These are Entity, System ID, Bank Ref, Beneficiary or Ccy fields. To display all records, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields.
The columns returned in the list of payments are the following:

Field
Description
System ID
Unique reference number generated by for this file, when it was initiated.
Entity
The Entity associated with the payment.
Bank Ref.
Identifier the bank uses for this payment.
Beneficiary
The Beneficiary of the payment.
Product Type
The type of recurring payment.
Ccy
The Currency of the LC.
Amount
The amount of the LC.
PAB
Is the Beneficiary an authorised, Pre Approved Beneficiary?
Transfer Date
The date of the next payment
Post Dated
Has the transaction been post dated? (Yes or No)
To select a bulk payment to be terminated, click on the System ID of the require payment and complete the termination details and click the terminate button.
